paper_abstract: Let n >= 1 be an integer. Given a vector a = (a(1),...,a(n)) is an element of R(n), write a(+) := (max{a(1),0},...,max{a(n),0}) (the 'projection of a onto the positive orthant'). For a set A subset of R(n) put A(+) := {a(+) : a is an element of A} and A - A := {a - b : a,b is an element of A}. Improving previously known bounds, we show that \(A - A)(+)\ >= \A\(3/5)/6 for any finite set A subset of R(3), and that \(A - A)(+)\ >= c\A\(6/11) /(log \A\)(2/11) with an absolute constant c > 0 for any finite set A subset of R(4) such that \A\ >= 2.
paper_title: Projecting Difference Sets on the Positive Orthant
